Posts.Content: Great News Monica! Now you can concentrate on resting and getting well! Have an amazing Thanksgiving! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: post op update

Posts.Content: Hi Tara! Sorry you're still so uncomfortable. Good luck with your test on Tues. Hopefully, they'll find the cause and will be able to treat it so you can get on with your life. My thoughts and prayers are with you. Keep us informed! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Another Test

Posts.Content: Tara! I'm so sorry you are going thru another scare! I know it's easier said than done but try to relax(at least not panic) until you have all the facts and you know what you are dealing with! I'm so glad you returned here for support! I never left! Although I don't say much, I still return daily to read and see what is going on. The pink sisters here are all wonderful and will support you thru your whole ordeal! Please try to relax! I'm here if you need to chat! HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Here I am again

Posts.Content: Rosa, you're awsome!! Keep up your sense of humor. I never laugh as much as I do when I read some of your posts. Thanks!! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: aching arms and legs

Posts.Content: Hi Sue. Sorry you're uncomfortable. Keep complaining to the MD. He should give you something! There are plenty of different meds he can order. Quality of life is a big issue. Keep at him! HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: aching arms and legs

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy. Sorry you're having another scare. Don't jump to conclusions yet. It's possible it's just a normal change in the endometrial lining. I had an ultrasound last week and mine also showed changes but the MD said it is a normal change on a uterous of someone taking Tamoxifen. Take a deep breath and wait to worry when and if you have something to worry about. I'll be thinking of you. Keep in touch. Let us know what's happening. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: worried

Posts.Content: My thoughts and prayers are are with Carter and his family! HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Prayers for Carter

Posts.Content: This has been the greatest support group I could ever imagine. I didn't know about this till after I had my mastectomy and reconstruction. I have met more amazing ladies and gentlemen who are going through a rough time and everyone has been so supportive. The knowledge some of you ladies have is truely amazing! I will be an 8 year survivor in Sept. and still look foward to coming to this site several times a day and reading all the posts.Back in the beginning, I felt very connected to many amazing women , a few,whom I still chat with on a regular basis. I am a quiet observer now, but, I am here daily so I still feel connected but in a different way. Thank you all for your support and knowledge. You're an amazing group. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: support in the flesh

Posts.Content: Hi Jean! Celebrex, Vioox and Bextra are great for arthritic pain! They are also less troublesome to the stomach.I swear by all of them! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: St. John's Wort and Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Just thought you might like to know that this thread was initially written in Dec. 2000 and the person who wrote it is no longer a regular on this site. Thank you for the info. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Sore and dry mouth

Posts.Content: Wendy, Thank you for keeping us posted about your procedure and status. How cruel to have you in the hospital all ready for the procedure and then cancel it and make you wait several more days. You've been through enough waiting!!! Hopefully everything will go well on Friday! I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. Looking foward to your next post. Many, many HUGS!!!!!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Quick Update

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy and Tram Flap Reconstruction 9 yrs. ago. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me here or PM me here. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Got New Breast from tummy

Posts.Content: Just bumping this up so you all can see it. Sorry, I can't make it cause I'll be at work. Please post any interesting info that comes from the call. Thanks! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Conference Call Questions - Do you have some ready?

Posts.Content: Grandma! You should try drinking a high calorie drink like Ensure not a drink used for weightloss! There are many high calorie drinks out there with many different flavors. Drinking them cold isn't too bad and you can add ice cream to the too! Good luck to you and your husband! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy! Glad you caught the Cancer early! I can't tell you anything about the sentinal node biopsy as I didn't have to have it. As far as Receptors, if you are ER(estrogen)+, you would be put on some sort of medication like Tamoxifen or Femara or a few others that blocks the estrogen production. Being ER-, there is nothing for you to take.Don't worry about this at this point. Get thru the node biopsy and then see what the next plan of care will be. Good luck! I will be praying for you. Let us know how everything goes. I was also Stage 1 but I had DCIS,noninvasive cancer, therefore, I had a mastectomy and reconstruction and didn't need chemo or Radiation. HUGS!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Receptors??

Posts.Content: Congratulations Susan! Good Job! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Good news!

Posts.Content: What great news to hear! Congratulations! Thank you for letting us know. I've been wondering how you are and missing all your informative posts! Hope you have a great holiday and look foward to hearing from you when you get another chance to come by. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: A quick fly-by from dmc

Posts.Content: I was dx by annual mammo in Aug, 2000 and had mastectomy and Tram Flap Reconstruction on Sept. 11,2000. I am now 58 and will be cancer free for 10 years in Sept.. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: age when diagnosed?

Posts.Content: December 6th I was 58 and a 9 year survivor! HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: When is your Birthday?

Posts.Content: I was dx by annual mammo in Aug, 2000 and had mastectomy and Tram Flap Reconstruction on Sept. 11,2000. I am now 58 and will be cancer free for 10 years in Sept.. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: age when diagnosed?

Posts.Content: Hi Pam! Thank you so much for keeping us abreast(no pun intended!) about your status! You are just amazing! You are such an inspiration to everybody. You are going thru so much and feeling so bad yet you find the time and energy to keep us informed! I wish there was a way I could help you. I'll keep you in my thoughts and prayers! Don't give up! Continue to fight like hell!! We all love you! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Now on Zeloda

Posts.Content: I was dx by annual mammo in Aug, 2000 and had mastectomy and Tram Flap Reconstruction on Sept. 11,2000. I am now 58 and will be cancer free for 10 years in Sept.. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: age when diagnosed?

Posts.Content: December 6th I was 58 and a 9 year survivor! HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: When is your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Hi Denise. I'm Cathy. I had my nipple reconstructed Feb. 2. It's amazing what they can do. It remains very large 2-3 times larger than my other one but it take approx. 3 mos. to shrink in half. Then I get the tattoo and he ties the nipple somehow to make it look like the other one. There is an end in site! Good luck with your surgery. Keep in touch. Cathy
Posts.Title: I Always Learn the Hard Way!!!

Posts.Content: Happy B-day! Mine is Dec. 6
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Happy B-day! Mine is Dec. 6
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Sorry you're not feeling great. Sometimes we have to learn things the hard way. At least you were able to see how great you look with your new boob! Put it in a safe place. This will give you something to look foward to using in the future! Keep in touch! Cathy
Posts.Title: I Always Learn the Hard Way!!!

Posts.Content: Lots of snow here in Westchester County just north of NYC. We were lucky last weekend as it passed by us and we didn't get a flake but today, it hasn't stopped.! I didn't go to work today but have to go tomorrow. Hope everybody is warm and staying safe. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: SOCKED WITH SNOW......IN PHILADELPHIA

Posts.Content: I just wanted to wish you all a Happy and Healthy Christmas andNew Year! You're all a wonderful and caring group and deserve only the best!
Posts.Title: MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL

Posts.Content: Hi Gayle! Glad you have managed so well following surgery. The tube removal is quick. A quick pull and they're out. It's uncomfortable for a second but nothing bad. I had 2 tubes in the armpit and 2 in the abdomen(I had a Tram flap reconstruction.) The abdomen was more uncomfortable than the armpit! Good luck with the path reports. I'm praying for good news for you. Cathy
Posts.Title: post-mastectomy drain tube

Posts.Content: Tiger, I agree! Maybe we're creatures of habit, but this is confusing. The only thing I like is the chat room. That's neat! I was on this PM with someone and it worked well. Maybe we just have to give it time! Talk to you later. Cathy(CRUF)
Posts.Title: huh?

Posts.Content: Where are you going in NYC? I'm also going in. We're going to Radio City to see the Christmas Show and The Rockettes then to DelFresco's Steak House. Have a great time. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Our 35th anniversary

Posts.Content: Hi! I had the same problem after the lumpectomy with the lateral margin not being clear. I chose to have a mastectomy with immediate reconstruction. I'm very glad I did it that way. Knowing that the cancer is gone is much easier to live with than worrying about whether the radiation killed all the cells. I'm not happy that I had to go through all this but the results have been good and I know at this point I'm free of cancer. I'll go for my 2nd mammo and ultrasound in July. Hope everything is still good then!Good luck with your decision. You have to do what's best for you! I did what was best for me. Keep us informed. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: DCIS followup

Posts.Content: Hi! Yes, I had an ultrasound last time and will continue with each mammo. My tissue has become more dense, probably from the Tamoxifen, and they want to be sure there is nothing hiding in the dense tissue. I guess they can get a clearer picture with the ultrasound! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: DCIS followup

Posts.Content: Hi Mel! I had a tramflap recon. My abdomen is my uncomfortable area. Hope you are feeling better. I never had any breast pain at all. The entire breast is numb! I guess I'm lucky ion some respects. The MD hasn't had to use a local when doing any procedures cause I can't feel them. Keep in touch. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Questions re: nipple recon recovery??????

Posts.Content: I have you all beat! I joined in Oct. 2000. I was alot more active back then. I have met many amazing ladies,and men, thru this site. I actually write privately to a few ladies from back then. I have met a few in person. This IS an amazing site! I don't chime in often anymore but I am on reading posts everyday! Hang in everyone! HUGS!!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: How long have you been on this board?

Posts.Content: Hi Becky! Welcome to the group! Everybody here has been through what you went through one way or another. Feel free to join into any post or start one of your own. The ladies are all wonderful. Full of lots of knowledge,information,and love.Feel free to send E-mails at any time.I can be reached here or at RPT1206@aol.com. Keep in touch! HUGS!!! Cathy(cruf)
Posts.Title: Hello new

Posts.Content: Hi Mel. I had the nipple reconstruction and had no discomfort! That area is totally numb so there was no pain. My nipple was made from tissue they removed from within the reconstructed breast(I'm not sure how they did it!) I had a hard dressing over the nipple for 1 week to protect it from any trauma,or pressure. I had a 2nd procedure to make the nipple smaller, then the tatoo to give it color and will have another procedure on Thurs. to fix the nipple. It is receding into the tissue so the definition isn't as good as it should. None of these procedures has caused any discomfort at all. Good luck. I'm sure you'll be happy with your final results. It's amazing what they can do! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Questions re: nipple recon recovery??????

Posts.Content: What an amazing end to 2010 and a great way to begin 2011! Congratulations! HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: The Miracle of Life.... I just had to share...

Posts.Content: Hi Mark! I also developed a lump under my arm and it is common. May just be scar tissue. Don't get too upset until you get all the facts! Good luck! Keep in touch! Cathy
Posts.Title: a new problem

Posts.Content: Hi Tara. I'm so glad you will finally be going on a long ,well deserved vacation. The fact that you're surprising your mom will make it even better. Have a great ,Happy and Healthy trip. We will continue to keep you in our thoughts and prayers! ENJOY! FEEL GOOD! Talk to you when you get back! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Just a note

Posts.Content: I took tamoxifen for 5 years and only side effects were hot flashes and vaginal discharge. I didn't gain any weight which I have read other ladies complain about. I do get checked 2 x a year by my Gynocologist for uterine cancer via internal US. After 5 years I switched to femara for 8 mos then Aromasin for 1 1/2 years and that's another story! Good luck with the Tamoxifen. It's very doable! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen..How did everyone do on it??

Posts.Content: Hi Jamie! I think if I were told I had a cyst on my ovarie from a GP I would go see my Gynocologist. That's their speciality. I think I would want to pursue it a bit beyond There's nothing to do. If the GYN agrees, then I would be a bit more comfortable but would keep a close watch on it. Good luck! Keep us informed about your decision and the end result! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Results from Worried

Posts.Content: Hi Lili! I had my mastectomy and reconstruction 8 years ago. I had a tram flap so therefore, about 7 or 8 procedures. I had my nipple and areola reconstructed and then had my nipple fixed again as it flattened out. Guess what? It flattened out again. I had a dent above my new breast and had it injected with a filler which didn't work so I had a fat transfer from my posterior thigh. Guess what? I still have a dent. I decided it wasn't something I really needed to fix. It wasn't all that obvious to others as my clothing pretty much covered it up. Yes, when I wear my bathing suit it can be noticed but I decided I wasn't going to let this bother me. There are so many other things bigger than this to bother me at this point in life so I put it on the back burner. My husband never commented on it. My 23 yr old daughter noticed it for the first time over Christmas this year but that was ok. Would I like it to look like the other side? Of course,but I decided I had enough surgery and this was not a major health risk. Of course, you do what you feel is important to you. I just wanted you to know that I have a similiar problem but finally decided to stop trying to look perfect and just be happy with me.Good luck with whatever you decided. I'm sure you will be happy with your decision. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: DIEP reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Gramma44! Why wait till Nov. to speak to your Onc. if you're so uncomfortable? Maybe he could suggest something to help ease the pain. There are so many good medications out there. I'm also concerned about the Femara. I will be starting it in a few days just finishing my 5 years of Tamoxifen. I can't really say that I've had a bad time on Tamoxifen other than the hot flashes and night sweats. I also have some joint pain in my hands , elbows and shoulders but have been on meds. for a week and notice alot of improvement. I was stage 0, Estrogen +, Mastectomy and Tram Flap Reconstruction. I am willing to try the meds to prevent recurrance but if the side effects are bad, I'll just have to hope I don't get the BC back. Hope you're feeling better. Let us know what the onc. says. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Femara side effects?

Posts.Content: I had a tram flap 8 years ago .I returned to work (I'm a Physical Therapist in a Nursing Home)and back on the tennis court in 7 weeks playing like I never stopped. The only thing I really can't do is do a situp and I did notice I had a little trouble going backwards for an overhead shot. My balance was a little unsteady as I didn't have my abdominal muscles to stabilize me. You learn how to compensate for the muscle loss. One thing that is important is to be aware of your back. With weak stomach muscles comes a chance for back problems.I was terrified of the surgery but never once regretted it. Please feel free to e-mail me here and I will answer any questions I can help you with. HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: DIEP reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Judy. I'm 49 and had my first colonoscopy this year due to bleeding. Thank god it was only hemorrhoids. The test was a breeze! The prep is the difficulty. Good luck on Mon. I'll be thinking of you. HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer & Colon Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Pam! So glad to hear your news about the shrinking(disappearing lung tumors and the decreased markers.You have such a great attitude. I wish your pain would go away. You, Rosa and so many of these women have been through such hell yet you keep on fighting!Keep up the good work. I continue praying for you. Thanks for keeping in touch. I worry when I don't hear from some of the "old timers". HUGS!!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Halway results

Posts.Content: Sue, Rosa's last name is Moore. She will be truely missed by all! HUGS!! Cathy
Posts.Title: Dave's address for sympathy messages

Posts.Content: Good luck Claudia! I'll be thinking and praying for you today! Please let us know how you make out! HUGS!!! Cathy
